context: By 2015, the mobile device management market had matured significantly following the rise of smartphones and tablets. Jamf was chosen by IBM in 2015 to manage its Macs, marking a major validation of its enterprise capabilities. The competitive landscape included cross-platform MDM providers like AirWatch (acquired by VMware in 2014) and MobileIron that supported multiple operating systems (iOS, Android, Windows, BlackBerry), as well as Apple-focused solutions. The development of Exchange ActiveSync had led directly to the MDM industry boom. Jamf differentiated itself through deep Apple expertise and zero-day support for new Apple releases.
